$TSLA Is Tesla A $1,000 Stock? https://seekingalpha.com/article/4142139-tesla-1000-stock

links.title: Is Tesla A $1,000 Stock?
links.description: Last year, my team and I at Worm Capital posited an idea: Tesla, the teenage upstart, had essentially already won the electric vehicle war against General Motors, the 110-year-old behemoth. In an age marked by technological disruption, our argument was-and still is-that startups led by capable management are better positioned to lead us into the future than the incumbents.

messages.body: $TSLA https://electrek.co/2018/02/02/tesla-semi-electric-truck-customers-megacharger-charging-station/

links.title: Tesla is in talks with electric truck customers to install 'Megacharger' stations, report says
links.description: When Tesla unveiled its all-electric truck, Tesla Semi, last year, it made several impressive claims about the vehicle's specs and capabilities - leaving us to believe that it relies on significant battery improvements. One of those impressive aspects is the 'Megacharger' technology, which Elon Musk claims could add "400 miles of range to a Tesla Semi in 30 minutes."

messages.body: $TSLA Tesla's solar products are rolling out to hundreds of Home Depot stores. https://stocknews.com/news/tsla-tesla-inc-tsla-now-sells-solar-at-home-depot-with/

links.title: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Now Sells Solar At Home Depot, With Lowe's Likely To Follow
links.description: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) is partnering up with major home improvement store operators in the U.S. to sell its growing line of solar and battery products. Bloomberg has more details on what appears to be a natural fit for the electric vehicle-energy hybrid company: The tech pioneer, best known for its electric cars, is beginning to roll out Tesla-branded selling spaces at 800 of the retailer's locations, the company confirmed to Bloomberg News.

messages.body: $TSLA Tesla is using leases as collateral to raise more money. https://stocknews.com/news/tsla-tesla-inc-tsla-gets-creative-in-newest-cash-raise/

links.title: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Gets Creative In Newest Cash Raise
links.description: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) needs money, and it'll take it wherever it can get it. In fact, the electric vehicle maker is now using its own car leases as collateral for a $546 million, tapping non-traditional means of raising funds.
